text.p: GE Capital Services on Thursday said diversified manufacturer Pacific Dunlop Ltd had accepted its takeover bid for transport equipment hire firm Loscam Ltd.

GE Capital Services, a unit of the United States-based General Electric Co, said in a statement Pacific Dunlop's acceptance meant it was now entitled to 80.74 percent of Loscam's issued capital and would soon push for 90 percent.

GE Capital Services said it would waive all conditions to its offer and shorten payment terms once it became entitled to 90 percent. Cheques would then be sent to accepting shareholders within five business days of the receipt of acceptance forms.

"We encourage all Loscam shareholders to now accept as soon as possible and benefit from GE Capital Services' proposal to shorten its payment term once it receives acceptances representing 90 percent of Loscam's issued capital," GE Capital Services chief executive David Moffatt said.
GE Capital Services' bid of 43 cents per share valued Losam at A$54 million.
The GE Capital Services statement also said the offer had won the approval of the Australian government under foreign investment guidelines.
